summary: This is an email chain from November 21, 2019, in which a HuffPost reporter inquires whether Britain's Prince Andrew will submit to questioning by U.S. investigators regarding Jeffrey Epstein's potential co-conspirators. The email is forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Nicholas Blase
persons.context: Appears as the sender/forwarder of an email within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a media inquiry about Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Sara Boboltz
persons.context: A reporter for HuffPost who sent an email inquiry asking for confirmation on whether Prince Andrew will submit to questioning by U.S. investigators regarding Jeffrey Epstein's potential co-conspirators.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Britain's Prince Andrew, who is reported to be preparing to submit to questioning by U.S. investigators looking into Jeffrey Epstein's potential co-conspirators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is referenced as the central figure in the investigation, with U.S. investigators looking into his potential co-conspirators.

connections.description: Prince Andrew is the subject of a U.S. investigation into Epstein's potential co-conspirators, indicating a prior association under scrutiny.
Reporter Sara Boboltz sends a media inquiry to the U.S. Attorney's Office, where Nicholas Blase is involved in handling the correspondence.

events.title: Media inquiry about Prince Andrew's cooperation
events.description: HuffPost reporter Sara Boboltz emails the U.S. Attorney's Office asking for confirmation on whether Prince Andrew will submit to questioning by U.S. investigators regarding Jeffrey Epstein's potential co-conspirators.

keyFacts: On November 21, 2019, HuffPost reporter Sara Boboltz inquired with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York about whether Prince Andrew would submit to questioning by U.S. investigators.
The inquiry was based on a Telegraph report stating Prince Andrew was preparing to be questioned regarding Jeffrey Epstein's potential co-conspirators.
The email correspondence indicates ongoing media and official interest in Prince Andrew's connection to the Epstein investigation as of late 2019.
The document shows internal forwarding of a media inquiry within the U.S. Attorney's Office, specifically involving Nicholas Blase.
